revision.text:
{{Infobox military person |name = Cyrus Sears |image = |birth_date = March 10, 1832 |death_date = November 30, 1909 |birth_place = [[Meredith, New York|Meredith]], [[New York (state)|New York]] |death_place = |placeofburial = Oak Hill Cemetery, [[Upper Sandusky, Ohio|Upper Sandusky]], [[Ohio]] |allegiance = [[United States of America]] |branch = [[United States Army]]
[[Union Army]] |serviceyears = |rank = [[First lieutenant#U.S. Army, U.S. Marine Corps and U.S. Air Force|First lieutenant]] |unit = [[11th Ohio Battery|11th Battery, Ohio Light Artillery]] |battles = [[Battle of Iuka]]
[[American Civil War]] |awards = {{Flagicon image|Medal of Honor ribbon.svg}} [[Medal of Honor]] }} '''Cyrus Sears''' (March 10, 1832 – November 30, 1909) was an [[United States|American]] soldier who fought in the [[American Civil War]]. Sears received his country's highest award for bravery during combat, the [[Medal of Honor]].{{cite web |url=http://valor.militarytimes.com/recipient.php?recipientid=535|title=Cyrus Sears|accessdate=January 10, 2016}} Sear's medal was awarded for his heroism during the [[Battle of Iuka]] in Mississippi on 19 September 1862. He was honored with the award on December 31, 1892.{{cite web|url=http://www.history.army.mil/moh/civilwar_sz.html#SEARS|title=Civil War (S-Z) Medal of Honor Recipients|accessdate=January 10, 2016}} Sears was born in [[Meredith, New York]], and entered service in [[Bucyrus, Ohio]]. He was buried in [[Upper Sandusky, Ohio]]. ==Medal of Honor citation== {{quotation|The President of the United States of America, in the name of Congress, takes pleasure in presenting the Medal of Honor to First Lieutenant (Field Artillery) Cyrus Sears, United States Army, for extraordinary heroism on 19 September 1862, while serving with Battery 11, Ohio Light Artillery, in action at Iuka, Mississippi. Although severely wounded, First Lieutenant Sears fought his battery until the cannoneers and horses were nearly all killed or wounded.}} ==See also== *[[List of American Civil War Medal of Honor recipients: Qâ€“S]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sears, Cyrus}} [[Category:1832 births]] [[Category:1909 deaths]] [[Category:American Civil War recipients of the Medal of Honor]] [[Category:People from Washington County, Ohio]] [[Category:People of New York in the American Civil War]] [[Category:People of Ohio in the American Civil War]] [[Category:Union Army officers]] [[Category:United States Army Medal of Honor recipients]]
